author: __flcl
content:
<@892053833121923094> <@412614104222531604> hello!
We have added 3/6 and custom kzg file support 
Branch(the same): feature/eip-4844-v6
Image(changed): nethermindeth/nethermind:eip-4844-v6-36

Custom kzg setup flag: `--Init.KzgSetupPath /pth/to/kzg_trusted_setup.txt`
Standard size setup is supported only

author: __flcl
content: Yep

author: g11tech
content: one question : for 3/6 blobs limit is the subnet count to be increased as well for blob topics: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3416

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> agreed on the subnet count

author: jgm
content: What are the rules around maintaining blob data?  I'm attempting to hit `/eth/v1/beacon/blob_sidecars/13437` as per the <@792822129019584562> example above but being returned a 404.  Are the blobs discarded pretty quickly by some nodes (at a guess the node I'm querying is teku, although <@412614104222531604> can confirm).

author: g11tech
content: the blobs have to be retained till 4096 epochs window

author: g11tech
content: but it could be teku started with checkpoint sync post this, and didn't backfill to this window

author: g11tech
content: here is my PR to clarify the window : https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3417

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> This is not the intended behavior, see my commet on the PR

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> note, there are two different methods â€” by root and by range. by  root is pruned eagerly if finalization happens, but both cannot grow past the prune window

author: g11tech
content: aha!

author: g11tech
content: thanks for the clarification, may be clarification be made explicit in the specs?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> this is something of an analog in phase 0 beaconblockbyroot
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/p2p-interface.md#beaconblocksbyroot

> Clients MUST support requesting blocks since the latest finalized epoch.

The max as it currently is written is difficult to parse. I'm okay with clarifying text

author: g11tech
content: actually it makes sense since by root block is not guaranteed before finalization as well, closed PR

author: jgm
content: Will beacon nodes have the ability to manage the number of epochs worth of blobs they store beyond the minimum?  Or, more usefully, be able to work with an external blob server to obtain blobs?

author: g11tech
content: opened the clarification PR: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3420

author: g11tech
content: you mean configuring via an option? should be possible but not yet supported i think

author: g11tech
content: Also i don't think we have anywhere in beacon-apis clarify till what window blobsidecars will be available, although one can assume this window to be same as `MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOB_SIDECARS_REQUESTS`

author: jgm
content: Fair enough; haven't had the time to focus on deneb before now, but should have some time Soon to take a look and consider.
